name: ideational
content:

relating to or involving the activity of forming ideas in the mind: This branch of linguistics distinguishes between the ideational, interpersonal, and textual functions of language. A distinction is made between the observable aspects of a culture and its more ideational elements, such as values, assumptions, and beliefs.
More examplesFewer examplesThe ideational dimension of the project was important because it aimed at changing perceptions.He believed that the ideational foundations of society were often taken for granted.
